knowledge: Food poisoning Food poisoning  Symptoms of food poisoning can vary depending on the source of the infection. Common symptoms include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever. Symptoms may appear within hours of eating contaminated food, or they may take several days to develop. Most cases of food poisoning are self-limiting and resolve within a few days. However, in some cases, food poisoning can be serious and even life-threatening, especially in young children, older adults, pregnant women, and people with weakened immune systems. Symptoms that require immediate medical attention include fever higher than 101.5°F, bloody stools, prolonged vomiting, severe dehydration, and signs of shock, such as confusion, rapid heartbeat, and low blood pressure.
response: The symptoms of food poisoning are nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and fever, and they may appear within hours of eating contaminated food, or they may take several days to develop.
